name: annotate-open-reading-frames
title: Annotate Open Reading Frames (ORFs)
description: Find all Open Reading Frames (ORFs) in a DNA sequence using Biopython
content:
Overview

This application identifies all Open Reading Frames (ORFs) in a DNA sequence. ORFs are sequences of DNA that start with a start codon (ATG) and end with a stop codon (TAA, TAG, or TGA) in the same reading frame.

Features

  • Searches all three forward reading frames
  • Optional reverse complement strand search
  • Filters nested ORFs (optional)
  • Provides amino acid translations
  • Includes summary statistics

Parameters

  • DNA Sequence: Input DNA sequence to analyze
  • Minimum Length: Minimum ORF length in nucleotides (typically 30-300)
  • Search Reverse: Enable to search reverse complement strand
  • Filter Subsets: Enable to remove nested ORFs

Output

Returns a JSON file containing summary statistics and detailed information for each ORF including sequence, amino acid translation, position, strand, and reading frame.
command: git clone https://github.com/CamberCloud-Inc/prod_apps.git prod_apps_clone 2>/dev/null || (cd prod_apps_clone && git pull) && pip install -q biopython biomni && python prod_apps_clone/biomni/molecular_biology/annotate_open_reading_frames.py "${sequence}" ${minLength} ${searchReverse} ${filterSubsets} -o "${outputDir}"
